definition: tone (of voice)/tune
variant of 掉頭|掉头[diao4 tou2]
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The alley is too narrow to turn around, you'll have to back out.
sentences.chinese: 这条巷子太窄了，不能调头，你只能倒车出去。

sentences.english: In this paper, the method and measures for turnover boring with high coaxality are expounded.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要阐述实施高同轴度调头镗孔的方法和措施。

sentences.english: He immediately turned the cab around and returned the child to her relieved family.
sentences.chinese: 他立刻把计程车调头，把小孩还给如释重负的家人。

sentences.english: If it was not, he would leave and come again another day.
sentences.chinese: 要是有人，他就调头改天再来。

sentences.english: The large ship was easily tacked into the wind.
sentences.chinese: 那艘大船轻易地调头顶风航行。

sentences.english: I had no problem with the u-turn?

definition: to turn one's head/to turn round/to turn about
to turn back
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
to turn around
to turn/to go around a corner
to steer (the plane) away from/to drive away (from a place)/to leave
to accelerate/to step on the gas
northward/facing north
to go straight/straight forward/fig. to do right
to avoid/to yield (in traffic)/to get out of the way
to turn left
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to turn right
(of a car, ship, train etc) to enter
to run away/to flee in disarray
to leave port/to put off
